alert.note: Alert for Kiowa (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 06 at 10:42PM MDT until July 07 at 1:45AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Kiowa County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 145 AM MDT. * At 1042 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. These storms have a history of producing heavy rain over the southeast plains this evening. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, streets as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sheridan Lake and Towner. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
